questionList.qu: ____ are suppliers who allow a business to purchase goods and/or services on trade credit
questionList.solution: Creditors are suppliers who allow a business to purchase goods and/or services on trade credit

questionList.qu: Short-term assets that belong to a firm
questionList.solution: Current assets are short-term assets that belong to a firm which are expected to remain in business for up to 12 months

questionList.qu: Fall in value of fixed assets over time (HL)
questionList.solution: Depreciation is the fall in value of fixed assets over time
Final accounts are annual financial statements that all limited liability companies are legally obliged to report

questionList.qu: Items owned by a business not intended for sale and used to generate revenue
questionList.solution: Fixed assets are items owned by a business not intended for sale and used to generate revenue

questionList.qu: An intangible asset which exists when the value of a firm exceeds its book value
questionList.solution: Goodwill is an intangible asset which exists when the value of a firm exceeds its book value

questionList.qu: Difference between sales revenue of a business and its direct costs of operation
questionList.solution: Gross profit is the difference between sales revenue of a business and its direct costs of operation

questionList.qu: ____ refers to the purchase cost of a particular fixed asset
questionList.solution: Historic cost refers to the purchase cost of a particular fixed asset

questionList.qu: Assets that do not exist in a physical form
questionList.solution: Furture assets are assets that do not exist in a physical form
Net profit is the value of all assests minus its liabilities

questionList.qu: A fincancial record of a firm's trading activity over the past 12 months
questionList.solution: The profit and loss account is a fincancial record of a firm's trading activity over the past 12 months

questionList.qu: Amount of net profit after interest, tax and dividends.
questionList.solution: Retained profit is the amount of net profit after interest, tax and dividends have been paid.

questionList.qu: Amount of money raised through sale of shares
questionList.solution: Share capital is the amount of money raised through sale of shares

questionList.qu: First section of the profit and loss account
questionList.solution: Trading account is the first section of the P&L account

questionList.qu: An estimate of the scrap/disposal value of the asset at the end of its useful life (HL)
questionList.solution: Residual value is an estimate of the scrap/disposal value of the asset at the end of its useful life
